content: 1st single_crochet 48 sts note the 1st single_crochet round after each cluster round will always be a bit fiddly as the chain st from the cluster will be tighter but have no fear the 2nd round of single_crochet will be easy 6 chain 1 beginning in the same stitch as the chain single_crochet in 1st 3 sts 2 single_crochet in the next stitch around join in top of 1st single_crochet 60 sts 7 chain 2 beginning in the same stitch as the chain cluster st chain 1 and skip the next st around don t forget the ch1 in the final stitch repeat remove marker join in top of 1st cluster 30 clusters 8 chain 1 beginning in the same stitch as the chain single_crochet in the 1st 4 sts 2 single_crochet in next st around remove marker join in top of 1st single_crochet 72 sts 9 chain 1 beginning in the same stitch as the chain single_crochet in each stitch around remove marker join in top of 1st single_crochet -- 72 sts the diameter of the crown at this point is 7 body of hat the body of the hat is worked even no increases a chain 2 beginning in the same stitch as the chain cluster st chain 1 and skip the next st around don t forget the ch1 in the final stitch repeat remove marker join in top of 1st cluster 36 clusters b chain 1 beginning in the same stitch as the chain single_crochet in each stitch around remove marker join in top of 1st single_crochet 72 sts c same as round b 4 | p a ge repeat rnds a through c until your hat measures 8 to 8½ from the top center of your hat you will determine how deep you wish your hat to be bottom band the band is created working only single_crochet stitches without a beginning chain you will single_crochet continuously without joining in this way your band will not have a visible seam however you should keep using the stitch marker so you can identify the beginning of each round single_crochet continuously moving the marker as you go until your hat measures 8½ to 9 from the top center of your hat more if you wish a deeper hat at the end of your last round of single_crochet remove the stitch marker and slip_stitch in the next 3 or 4 stitches to blend in the round bind-off cut the yarn leaving at least an 8-inch yarn end slip 1 more stitch and pull all the way through snug up the stitch to create a smooth join using the tapestry needle weave in the yarn ends and trim steam or block the hat if desired links to helpful tutorials
